#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Makassar
#Text=Makassar , formerly called Ujung Pandang , is the capital of South Sulawesi province .
#Text=It has the largest population of any city on the island of Sulawesi , Indonesia , and is the fifth largest city in Indonesia after Jakarta , Surabaya , Bandung and Medan .
#Text=The city is on the southwest coast of Sulawesi , facing the Makassar strait .
#Text=It is regarded as the gateway to the eastern part of Indonesia .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Makassar was the traditional capital of the Bugis kingdom ( Sultanate of Gowa ) .

#Text=The Bugis were known throughout the region as proud , fierce warriors and pirates and highly skilled mariners , and before the Dutch defeated them , they had a formidable empire and sphere of influence in what the Europeans called the " Spice Islands " .
#Text=The Bugis also traded throughout the region , and you can find Bugis people today in many other parts of Indonesia and beyond .
#Text=Makassarese cuisine , based as you might expect on seafood , is highly prized throughout the region , so make sure to have some while you are here .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Sultan Hasanuddin International Airport ( UPG ) ( is located 20 km from Makassar ) .
#Text=Acts as the primary hub for flights to Eastern Indonesia which encompasses the whole Sulawesi island , Maluku and Papua .
#Text=There are multiple flights from Indonesia 's capital , Jakarta as well as smaller cities such as Surabaya and Bali .
#Text=The only international flights are from Kuala Lumpur and Singapore ( not daily though ) .
#Text=Reaching Makassar city center from Sultan Hasanuddin International Airport
#Text=Taxi is the most feasible option and should cost around Rp 90,000 to the city ( as of 2016 ) .
#Text=The Airport Bus ( operated by Perum Damri ) is operating on the lower ground floor , linking the airport to the city .
#Text=Ticket costs Rp27,000 ( as of March 2019 ) .
#Text=If there is no one on the counter , you can board the bus and pay after the bus departs .
#Text=The bus should be departing at a 30-min internal .
#Text=The journey takes about one hour .
#Text=Airport bus ( city center ) .
#Text=Route : Airport ( start ) - Jl . P. Kemerdekaan - Jl . Urip Sumoharjo - Jl .
#Text=G. Bawakaraeng - Jl .
#Text=Kartini - Jl . Kajoalalido - Jl .
#Text=Arif Rate - Jl .
#Text=Sultan Hassanudddin - Jl .
#Text=Pattimura - Jl .
#Text=Ujung Pandang - Jl . Ribura'ne ( end )
#Text=By boat
#Text=The main port of Makassar is the Soekarno-Hatta Harbor .
#Text=Makassar is a major port for Pelni ships for Central and Eastern Indonesia .
#Text=It takes about 16 hours to Balikpapan , 24 to Surabaya , and 30 to Tanjung Priok .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Makassar has several bus terminals .
#Text=One of the most useful bus terminals is Terminal Daya , 200 m from the main road from Makassar to Pare-Pare ( and Rantepao ) .
#Text=The Daya bus terminal is the one that serves Tana Toraja .
#Text=Terminal Daya ( on the main road towards the airport ) .
#Text=Rp2000 .
#Text=Terminal Bintang Prima .
#Text=Terminal Litha ( On the main road towards the airport ( much closer to the city center than terminal Daya and terminal Bintang Prima ) ) .
#Text=A pete-pete from the city center to terminal Litha should cost Rp5000 .
#Text=By becak
#Text=Becak is a trishaw of unique design but minimalist compared to the ones in Java , can accommodate 2 small persons/children , but suitable only for one adult .
#Text=Fare depends on the distance , usually Rp8,000-15,000 around town .
#Text=By taxi
#Text=There 's a lot of taxi companies , all have the same fare and all use meters .
#Text=By petepete ( Angkot )
#Text=Petepete is the equivalent to other cities ' angkot ( angkutan kota/city transportation ) .
#Text=A trip in town usually costs Rp5000 .
#Text=By Trans Mamminasata
#Text=Trans Mamminasata ( Makassar , Sungguminasa and Takalar ) operates with Corridor-2 Trans Studio-Mal Panakukkang .
#Text=Not as TransJakarta which serve only inside Jakarta , Trans Mamminasata serve also to outside Makassar .
#Text=By Transportation Sharing Application
#Text=On-demand ( online )
#Text=ojek services such as Go-Jek and Grab are ubiquitous can be booked through their respective smartphone apps , and offer generally cheaper fares which are stated in advance .
#Text=Payments can be made by cash or using stored value ( akin to prepaid mobile phone service ) .
#Text=Go-Jek as a pioneer has more widespread availability ; those who travel here alongside other Southeast Asian countries may find it useful to keep using Grab .
#Text=The other more expensive on-demand ojek service is Lady Jek with female drivers .
#Text=Unlike conventional ojeks , which typically only operate dawn to dusk , they are available 24 hours and relatively safe for both passengers and drivers because they are monitored by GPS .
#Text=While it seems cheap , those who travel in groups of at least three may be better off taking a taxi for convenience and unnoticeable difference in fares .
#Text=Talk
#Text=Makassar is a multicultural city , but dominated by ethnic Makassar and Bugis .
#Text=Therefore , they have a lingua franca language that is , Makassar Malay Language ( Logat Makassar ) or can be called Indonesian Language dialect of Makassar .
#Text=Macassar Malay is not a creole , but a mixed Malay – Macassarese language , with Malay lexicon , Macassarese inflections , and mixed Malay/Macassarese syntax .
#Text=See
#Text=Losari Beach ( Pantai Losari ) .
#Text=The long stretch of waterfront in the middle of the city .
#Text=A very nice sunset view .
#Text=Food stalls set up every night here .
#Text=This is a hangout place .
#Text=Do not expect an actual sandy beach .
#Text=Fort Rotterdam .
#Text=An old fortress from Dutch colonial days .
#Text=Free entrance ( they will insist you sign a guestbook ) .
#Text=You will be requested to give a small donation , but you do not need to ( the money will go to the guards and not to the site ) .
#Text=The entrance fee for the Museum ( Museum La Galigo ) is Rp5000 for Indonesians , Rp10,000 for foreigners ( two buildings , but you just need to paid once ) .
#Text=If you are a foreigner , you will be the attraction for the locals there , some people may ask you to take photo with them .
#Text=The friendly attitude makes this experience quite fun , and you can learn a lot about Sulawesi as well from it .
#Text=Free entrance to main fort .
#Text=Pulau Khayangan .
#Text=A small island about 20 minutes away by boat from central Makassar .
#Text=Pulau Samalona .
#Text=A beautiful white sandy island with good diving .
#Text=Trip from Makassar takes 30-45 minutes , and costs Rp600,000-800,000 ( 1 boat can carry 2-8 people ) .
